value: major twin systems with slip accommodation

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_005_chunk4
evidence_span: When some $1 2 . 7 \mathrm { m m }$ $! / 2$ in.) thick plate material became available, I conducted a small-scale heat treatment-fabrication study to determine if the rolled material could be made more isotropic.

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_005_chunk4
evidence_span: What I found was that the anisotropy could be minimized but not eliminated by beta quenching and cold or warm rolling not less than $30 \%$ reduction and not more than $40 \%$ .
process_step: beta quenching, cold or warm rolling

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_005_chunk4
evidence_span: Rolling more, or less, increased the anisotropy.

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_005_chunk4
evidence_span: Beta quenching alone only intensified the existing basal pole texture.

evidence_span: This provided our first opportunity to conduct tension and compression tests along a concentration of basal poles.

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_005_chunk6
evidence_span: J. C. Wilson [...] had developed techniques and equipment to produce large, zone-refined single crystals of iodide zirconium up to 12.7 mm [1/2 in.] diameter by several inches long, as well as single crystals of Zircaloy-2 of similar size.

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_005_chunk6
evidence_span: J. C. Wilson [...] had developed techniques and equipment to produce large, zone-refined single crystals of iodide zirconium up to 12.7 mm [1/2 in.] diameter by several inches long, as well as single crystals of Zircaloy-2 of similar size.

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_005_chunk6
evidence_span: Single and bicrystal sheet specimens of Zircaloy-2 were also produced.

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_005_chunk6
evidence_span: The availability of such single crystals alowed us to begin a study of deformation systems operating in biaxial stress-strain tests, and tests in almost pure shear along most crystallographic directions.

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_005_chunk6
evidence_span: The availability of such single crystals alowed us to begin a study of deformation systems operating in biaxial stress-strain tests, and tests in almost pure shear along most crystallographic directions.

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_005_chunk6
evidence_span: The metallographically prepared cross sections of deformed single crystals of zirconium present unbelievably gorgeous abstract color "paintings" when viewed in polarized light and sensitive tint with a metallurgical microscope.

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_005_chunk6
evidence_span: We could predict with acceptable accuracy the texture and anisotropy of a lot of tubing, given the specific design of the die and mandrel and the detailed fabrication procedure.

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_005_chunk6
evidence_span: We could predict with acceptable accuracy the texture and anisotropy of a lot of tubing, given the specific design of the die and mandrel and the detailed fabrication procedure.

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_005_chunk6
evidence_span: We could also specify the several reductions steps with "Q' ratios (ratio of reductions in diameter and wall thickness) at each position in the die (though we did not then attempt to design a die and mandrel set) required to produce a desired texture and anisotropy.

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_005_chunk6
evidence_span: The problem then became one of quantifying the approximate relationships we were working with, determining the anisotropy of properties quantitatively, and proving the analyses.

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_005_chunk6
evidence_span: The anisotropy of optical properties of zirconium provide the potential of following the deformation strain field in front of and under the roll of a plate rolling mill, and how it is affected by the rolling speed, the reduction per pass, lubrication, ratio of roll diameter to the thickness of the plate, etc.

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_005_chunk6
evidence_span: a spatial alignment of basal pole orientations of a sheet of grains in rolled plate Zircaloy could lead to cracking and fracture of annealed Zircaloy during roller leveling.

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_005_chunk6
evidence_span: The material had the same "macro" pole figure as other plates which did not crack during roller leveling, but "strings" of grains (sheets in the plate) at about a 30° angle to the rolling plane underwent extinction in sequence during a 10 to 15° rotation of the stage of the microscope when viewing the transverse direction in polarized light.

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_005_chunk6
evidence_span: The plates susceptible to cracking had been processed at low reductions per pass (about 5%) and developed many shear bands going from surface to surface of the plate.

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_005_chunk6
evidence_span: The basal planes of the grains in these shear bands became aligned during deformation and remained so on annealing.

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_005_chunk6
evidence_span: These grains would deform by twinning in the small strain produced by roller leveling and would not untwin when the strain was reversed.

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_005_chunk6
evidence_span: Thus they cracked in the interface between the matrix and the shear band twins.

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_005_chunk6
evidence_span: This did not happen in plates rolled at high reductions per pass( 20% or more), since the shear bands did not develop.

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_005_chunk6
evidence_span: Despite several tries, no one has developed a good relationship between the grain size and the yields strengths in Zircaloy.

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_005_chunk6
evidence_span: Despite several tries, no one has developed a good relationship between the grain size and the yields strengths in Zircaloy.

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_005_chunk6
evidence_span: If annealed Zircaloy is carefully observed while being slowly rotated under polarized light in a metallurgical microscope, "groups" or "clusters" of neighboring grains will be seen to undergo extinction in sequence with a stage rotation of 10 to 15°.

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_005_chunk6
evidence_span: Such clusters may contain as few as 9 to 10 grains or as many as 25 on the plane of polish (they could be spherical clusters in the body of the plate).

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_005_chunk6
evidence_span: It is my opinion that these clusters act as single grains when being deformed and thus are the "effective" grain size.

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_005_chunk6
evidence_span: The optical anisotropy of the grains could allow measurements of the spatial orientations of the basal poles of all the grains in the cluster and produce a "micro" pole figure for that cluster.

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_005_chunk7
evidence_span: a thorough knowledge of the anisotropy of properties of Zircaloy
